guide touristique get started Welcome To Our app\n \n Uncover Korea, the land of captivating stories and flavorful cuisine Tourist Guide Your pocket-sized travel companion for seamless navigation, curated recommendations, and unforgettable experiences. Description
Seoul, South Korea Enter your... Search Categories Popular hotel Popular Restaurant Popular Garden Popular Temple See All

Four Seasons Hotel Seoul Just steps from Gwanghwamun Plaza, Four Seasons Hotel Seoul boasts commanding city views and features 5 in-house dining, a state-of-the art fitness facilities. 97, Saemunan-ro, Jongno-gu, 03183 Séoul Contact Us on : 05566666666
Escape hotel The Escape Hotel is located in Seoul and offers a fitness center and a bar. The front desk is open 24/7. Guests can also enjoy a restaurant on-site. Free Wi-Fi is provided. 67,Toegye-ro,Jung-gu,04529 Séoul Contact Us on : 05566666666
Ryse Hotel The RYSE, Autograph Collection Seoul is a hotel in the lively Hongdae area, near Hongik University subway station (Exit 9, with multiple lines). It offers free Wi-Fi and valet parking. 130, Yanghwa-ro, Mapo-gu, 04038 Séoul Contact Us on : 05566666666
Signiel Seoul The Signiel Seoul, a 5-star hotel high in the Lotte World Tower, offers panoramic city views, fine dining, an indoor pool, and a gym. Its directly connected to the Jamsil subway station and provides free Wi-Fi. 300, Olympic-ro, Songpa-gu, 05551 Seoul, South Korea Contact: +82-2-555-6666
Sofitel Ambassador Seoul Hotel luxurious 5-star hotel, blending French elegance with Korean hospitality near key attractions like Lotte World. It offers sophisticated rooms, diverse dining options, and excellent facilities 09, Jamsil-ro, Songpa-gu,05552 Séoul Contact Us on : 05566666666
Daol Charcoal Grill Daol Charcoal Grill Myeongdong Branch is a restaurant where you can taste representative K-food foods such as bulgogi, soybean paste stew and fresh food . 54-2, Myeongdong 2-ga 1st And 2nd Floors, Séoul 04536 Contact Us on :+888888
Flavors Indulge in delicious global cuisine in a dynamic and stylish atmosphere while dining at Flavors. Our restaurant is located in the JW Marriott Hotel Soul and serves breakfast, lunch and dinner daily 176 Sinbanpo-ro, Seocho-gu Séoul, Corée du Sud Contact Us on :+888888
Odarijip Myeongdong Located in the busiest area in Myeongdong, it provides a variety of menus includint most popular Korean food such as Galbi(beef), Samgyupsal(pork), Yukhoe(raw beef), Naengmyeon(cold noodle) and tteokbokki. 2F, 28 Myeongdong 8na-gil, Jung District, Seoul, Corée du Sud Contact Us on :+888888
Wonjomanlgobchang Korean restaurants that specialize in soup with bean sprouts Vegetarian food and specialized in the food and naturalism. Using only pure ingredients that provide healthy fofood. Friendly staff and reasonable prices is a good thing. 28, Myeongdong 8na-gil, Jung-gu 2F, Séoul 04536. Contact Us on :+888888
Mukshidonna Samcheongdong Samcheong-dong is famous for its Bukchon Hanok (Korean traditional houses) Village, surrounded by both Gyeongbokgung Palace and Changdeokgung Palace Many tourists come here to rent traditional Korean costume of Hanbok, walking around taking #OOTDs. It’s quite amusing to watch, really. Maybe one day I will get enough courage to do that 74-7, Yulgok-ro 3-gil, Jongno-gu, Seoul 03061 South Korea. Contact Us on :+88477888
Namsan Outdoor Botanical Garden There are several entrances. One popular route is to pass the overpass next to Hotel Hyatt in Itaewon. Local bus #3 reaches here.\n\nLots of flowers. There are well-maintained pine forest, bamboo forest, pavilions, ponds, stream, benches, little outdoor gyms, observation deck, kids\' park, flower garden, etc.\n\n- It\'s possible to climb up the mountain through this garden. 74-7, Yulgok-ro 3-gil, Jongno-gu, Seoul 03061 South Korea. Contact Us: +82-2-7788
Namsan Park A must do if you’re in Seoul but you have to walk it!! It only takes 45 minutes (one way) and it’s not too steep. As you get higher and higher, you’ll be stunned with amazing views of the city and beautiful autumn trees. Head for the cable car entrance and turn right, there’s a big brick wall called the Seoul city limit which you can follow all the way up to the top of the mountain and to the tower. A really nice way to spend a couple of hours as the afternoon turns into the evening 74-7, Yulgok-ro 3-gil, Jongno-gu, Seoul 03061 South Korea. Contact Us on :+88477888
Seoul Children s Grand Park This park has it all: rides, a zoo, a park, and a concert hall. Make sure to check out the most popular event: a dazzling water-fountain music and lights show. 74-7, Yulgok-ro 3-gil, Jongno-gu, Seoul 03061 South Korea. Contact Us on :+88477888
Seoul Iris Garden This is a nice park for neighbors. Not recommended to visit for tourists because the location is quite suburb of the city. -there are water showers for kids, sports courts, etc.. 916, Madeul-ro, Dobong-gu, Seoul 01318. Contact Us on :+88477888
Seoul Station Rooftop Garden This is a garden on the rooftop of Seoul Station. It has some interesting decoration. Good to take a look for minutes.. 916, Madeul-ro, Dobong-gu, Seoul 01318. Contact Us on :+88477888
Best for a natural escape: Hwagyesa Hwagyesa Temple offers a natural escape in Seoul, surrounded by lush greenery and peaceful trails, providing a serene retreat from the city. 117, Hwagyesa-gil, Suyu 1-dong, Gangbuk-gu, Seoul Contact Us on :+82-2-902-2663
Best for ancient traditions: Bongwonsa Bongwonsa Temple embodies ancient Korean Buddhist traditions through its historic rituals. It offers visitors an authentic glimpse into the heart of this cultural heritage. 55 Ujeongguk-ro, Jongno-gu, Seoul Contact Us on :+82-2-768-8600
Best classic favourite: Jogyesa Jogyesa Temple is the chief temple of the Jogye Order of Korean Buddhism, located in the heart of Seoul. Its vibrant and intricately decorated main hall, Daeungjeon, houses several important Buddhist statues and artifacts. The temple serves as a central hub for Buddhist practices, ceremonies, and cultural events, offering a serene and spiritual escape amidst the bustling city. Its ancient trees and peaceful courtyards provide a tranquil atmosphere for visitors seeking contemplation and a glimpse into Korean Buddhist traditions. 55 Ujeongguk-ro, Jongno-gu, Seoul Contact Us on :+82-2-768-8600
Bongeunsa temple Bongeunsa Temple, in Seouls Gangnam,is a peaceful evening retreat. Its serene atmosphere, softly lit by lanterns, offers a tranquil escape for quiet reflection and solitude. 67,Toegye-ro,Jung-gu,04529 Séoul Contact Us on : 05566666666
Myeong-dong Cathedral Myeong-dong Cathedral is a historic and architecturally impressive Gothic Revival church in central Seoul, a significant symbol of Korean Catholicism. Built in 1898, it has played a key role in the nations history and offers a peaceful respite in the vibrant Myeong-dong area. 77,Toegye-ro,Jung-gu,04529 Séoul Contact Us on : 055768896
